channel.title: Run.bat's
channel.description:
[b]I'm really interested in getting into coding private servers and todays my first day discovering them and looking into their sources, I have JRE 7 and JDK 7 on my computer that I've just installed and no run.bats seem to work, it would be fine it it was just the path within the speech marks, but I when I edit the Run.bat I see this:
@echo off title Project Insanity java -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar;-server -XX:+AggressiveHeap -XX:MaxHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:MinHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+RelaxAccessControlCheck -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:CompileThreshold=1 -XX:ThreadStackSize=128 server.Server pause
This is my problem: http://prntscr.com/14scqf If you could help me it would be appreciated, thank you. -Regression.

item.title: Run.bat's
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Flame_:

If the above solution does not solve the problem (implying that you did it correctly), then you will need to uninstall and reinstall Java (JDK comes with the compatible JRE type in the download).

Or. I mean, they could set up class paths, and get both the 64 bit and 32 bit java’s…

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat's
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

If the above solution does not solve the problem (implying that you did it correctly), then you will need to uninstall and reinstall Java (JDK comes with the compatible JRE type in the download).

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat's
item.dc:creator: @killerjens9 killerjens9
item.description:
@killerjens9 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:519146”]You don’t have classpath’s set up on your computer.
Change “java” to:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe”
I think that’s it at least…[/quote]
^ this should work

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat's
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You don’t have classpath’s set up on your computer.
Change “java” to:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe”
I think that’s it at least…

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat's
item.dc:creator: @Regression Regression
item.description:
@Regression wrote:

[b]I’m really interested in getting into coding private servers and todays my first day discovering them and looking into their sources, I have JRE 7 and JDK 7 on my computer that I’ve just installed and no run.bats seem to work, it would be fine it it was just the path within the speech marks, but I when I edit the Run.bat I see this:

@echo off title Project Insanity java -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar;-server -XX:+AggressiveHeap -XX:MaxHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:MinHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+RelaxAccessControlCheck -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:CompileThreshold=1 -XX:ThreadStackSize=128 server.Server pause

If you could help me it would be appreciated, thank you.
